images.copyright: Conwy Castle looking over the River Conwy, Wales (© David Chapman/Alamy)
images.title: Built to last
images.caption: Conwy, Wales
images.desc: Welcome to walled town of Conwy, on the north coast of Wales, UK, and its spectacular medieval castle. Conwy Castle was built between 1283 and 1287 on the orders of English King Edward I, during his conquest of Wales. Designed by James of St. George, one of the greatest architects of the time, the castle is a UNESCO World Heritage Site which draws visitors from across the world.
